body_html:
Hi Vijay,

I'm taking over for Aidan in adapting TensorFlow for the Knureon. I am currently working on some automated scripts that will help our work in sync with the tip of development on TensorFlow.

I am currently trying to figure out how to get my local TensorFlow build to run validation tests to so that I can be confident that the code snapshot I pulled from github is consistent with itself before merging it into our own work. Unfortunately Bazel is still a little new to me, so I am having trouble understanding the calls I need to make to get Bazel to run all tests in a class (we want to exclude the GPU tests for now), and not simply run line-by-line tests as described in your "Adding a New Op" tutorial. Is there a syntax similar to LLVM's 'lit' tool that allows for a class or regexp of test names to be run?

-Rich

Unfortunately Bazel is still a little new to me, so I am having trouble understanding the calls I need to make to get Bazel to run all tests in a class (we want to exclude the GPU tests for now), and not simply run line-by-line tests as described in your "Adding a New Op" tutorial. body:
Hi Vijay,

I'm taking over for Aidan in adapting TensorFlow for the Knureon.  I am currently working on some automated scripts that will help our work in sync with the tip of development on TensorFlow.

I am currently trying to figure out how to get my local TensorFlow build to run validation tests to so that I can be confident that the code snapshot I pulled from github is consistent with itself before merging it into our own work.  Unfortunately Bazel is still a little new to me, so I am having trouble understanding the calls I need to make to get Bazel to run all tests in a class (we want to exclude the GPU tests for now), and not simply run line-by-line tests as described in your "Adding a New Op" tutorial.  Is there a syntax similar to LLVM's 'lit' tool that allows for a class or regexp of test names to be run?

-Rich
